body:
This different re-org of posix.time into libc.time and posix.time more correctly mirrors the way libc.signal and posix.signal are split into standardC part and POSIX parts as well, as the way time.h and sys/time.h are split in the C interfaces.

It also is more suggestive of availability of functions on non-POSIX host platforms (such as Windows) with the lone exception of strptime.  That would be the only struct tm* function in posix.time if we put that there.

comment_data.body: Won't this drag a POSIX-specific `#include` into otherwise portable code?
I would put this in `posix.time` as well. It makes the import more explicit.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+# http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_date_and_time_functions
+
+from posix.types cimport clock_t, time_t
+from libc.stddef cimport wchar_t
+
+cdef extern from "time.h" nogil:
+    enum: CLOCKS_PER_SEC
+    clock_t clock()             # CPU time
+    time_t  time(time_t *)      # wall clock time since Unix epoch
+
+    cdef struct tm:
+        int  tm_sec
+        int  tm_min
+        int  tm_hour
+        int  tm_mday
+        int  tm_mon
+        int  tm_year
+        int  tm_wday
+        int  tm_yday
+        int  tm_isdst
+        char *tm_zone
+        long tm_gmtoff
+
+    int     daylight            # global state
+    long    timezone
+    char    *tzname[2]
+    void    tzset()
+
+    char    *asctime(const tm *)
+    char    *asctime_r(const tm *, char *)
+    char    *ctime(const time_t *)
+    char    *ctime_r(const time_t *, char *)
+    double  difftime(time_t, time_t)
+    tm      *getdate(const char *)
+    tm      *gmtime(const time_t *)
+    tm      *gmtime_r(const time_t *, tm *)
+    tm      *localtime(const time_t *)
+    tm      *localtime_r(const time_t *, tm *)
+    time_t  mktime(tm *)
+    size_t  strftime(char *, size_t, const char *, const tm *)
+    size_t  wcsftime(wchar_t *str, size_t cnt, const wchar_t *fmt, tm *time)
+
+    # POSIX not stdC
+    char    *strptime(const char *, const char *, tm *)

comment_data.body: True.  It will pull in sys/types.h which might fail in some build environments.  There was no libc/types.pxd in which to put clock_t and time_t.  It might well be a good idea to just ctypedef those in libc/time.pxd (as well as perhaps still leaving the posix.types ctypedef since POSIX always assumes standard C anyway).

Yeah.  strptime is admittedly a weird case - basically a POSIX-specific extension of the otherwise standard C struct tm family.  That's why I put that comment there.  That aspect of it seems to be a long-term source of confusion in the wider world as to its availability.  posix/time.pxd would just have to cimport the "tm" definition from libc.time if we wanted strptime in both places.

Arguably, it could cimport almost everything in libc.time, though it should be careful not to "cimport *" to avoid the "timezone" name collision that started this series of changes.  Why, that kind of superset-but-for-timezone posix.time would actually be the most backward compatible thing to do with the 0.21 release.  That release has only been out there in the wild to be depended upon for a short while.  So, it's unclear to me that such backward compatibility is important, and also such judgement calls are really more in Stefan/Robert's domains.

comment_data.body: POSIX also extends `<stdlib.h>`, see `posix/stdlib.pxd`. (And it extends `<string.h>` with `strdup`, but unfortunately that got put in `libc.string`...)

comment_data.body:
Yeah.  the libc/stdlib and posix/stdlib organization is yet another argument for doing things like this pull request.

The strdup thing is almost exactly like the strptime situation - grouping things according to the most related functions rather than according to specific standards.  I can see arguments both ways on that, but at a minimum we should have a note about the standard in the pxd file (currently not there for strdup).

commit.message: Move std C time APIs to libc.time; Move posix.sys_time to simply posix.time for system-level things like timer_* clock_*.
Re-organize so libc.time holds standard C things and posix.time POSIX things.
Change cimports to reflect pxd renames.
Fix cimport to reflect pxd re-org.
Change URI to wikipedia; Remove cimport of unused types; Highlight strptime's non-C-standardness.
Change CHANGES.rst to reflect the actual difference from 0.21 release.
Oops, accidentally deleted Stefan's change item during merge.

Remove libc/time.pxd dependency upon sys/types.h (on suggestion of Larsmans).
Also, remove clock_t from posix.types making users find it in libc.time.  It's
really a standard C type and not used anywhere in system interfaces anyway.

Merge /home/cb/pkg/cy/cython
Bring up to date with current master.

title: Change how posix/time.pxd is split up
